results.title: Economic change in a development country No.2: Wulukum
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
Discusses the socio-economic features of Wulukum, a Sepik village in the Torricelli Mountains, North-West New Guinea The film indicates the geographical location of the Wulukum village in the foothills of the Tarricelli Mountains near the Sepik River. It then shows how the changes have so far, provided little reinvestment of income into the village and that more positive changes will be required to stimulate further economic development.

results.title: Matalau: a Tolai Village in New Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
The last film in the series looks at a highly developed indigenous community - Matalau. Considers the impact Europeans have had on the traditional Tolai culture. Looks at the economy which is based on cash croppage - copra, cocoa, fishing and wage earning; and discusses future development.

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, ABC and Australia. Antarctic Division
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES

results.title: The Year of the Kings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
The final program in this series traces a full year’s life cycle of the King Penguin. These birds have had to adapt to a harsh environment on Macquarie Island, and have developed a well-organised social structure.

results.title: The Dominant male
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
One of four films about Macquarie Island. In September giant elephant seals come to mate and pup. This program follows events at the largest harem on the island, with 1,500 cows and 50 males. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary, production and photography by David Parer.

results.title: Ocean Wanderers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
Second in a series on the wildlife of Macquarie Island. The film shows the life cycles of the Wandering Albatross, the Rockhopper Penguin, the Black Browed Albatross and the Grey Headed Albatross

results.title: [Wool Fashion Awards, 1965 and 1966]
results.brief_description: Models show a variety of garments which won the Fashion Awards for 1966. Knitted jumpers, suits, skirts, and day and evening dresses, ensembles and coats. Photographed at Eltham using Montsalvat as a background.

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.
